text: Ivory Coast competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Ivory Coast has entered three swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Thibaut Danho |align=left|50 m freestyle |colspan=2| |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Lucie Kouadio-Patinier |align=left|50 m butterfly |35.43 |62 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m butterfly |1:26.46 |52 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Talita Te Flan |align=left|400 m freestyle |4:34.04 |36 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|800 m freestyle |9:21.19 |38 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Ivory Coast at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
title: Ivory Coast at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
